meanings.definition: Luffed (verb): to turn the head of a sailing vessel into the wind
meanings.sent1: The captain luffed the ship to face the strong wind.
meanings.sent2: The sailors luffed the boat to slow down and change direction.
meanings.sent3: As the ship luffed, the crew enjoyed the cool breeze on their faces.
meanings.sent4: The ship luffed like a graceful dancer twirling in the wind.
meanings.sent5: With a swift luff, the vessel changed its course dramatically.

meanings.definition: Luffed (adjective): having the sails set so as to catch the wind on the side towards which the vessel is steered
meanings.sent1: The luffed sails helped the boat move smoothly in the desired direction.
meanings.sent2: The sailors adjusted the luffed sails to maximize their speed.
meanings.sent3: The luffed sails fluttered like colorful flags in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The boat with luffed sails glided effortlessly across the water.
meanings.sent5: The luffed sails billowed proudly as the ship raced ahead.
